body: I meet the same problem on win10. I am using python3.
@rongrongxiangxin , the 3d convolution seems to require cudnn to be active ( see #4301 ).
Have you tested this on cudnn4?
@tqchen slice problem?

where is BLSTM? Please post a reproducible example
Also what's the version of your mxnet? Please try the latest version
@freddycct  I'm having the same problem: What did you do wrong? I believe I built mxnet correctly using Visual Studios

@andrewjylee hey, use dumpbin.exe /DEPENDENTS  to check which DLL file libmxnet.dll needs to have.

dumpbin.exe is in one of your visual studio folders
@andrewjylee does it work?
@freddycct I made a silly mistake of building in visual studio to DEBUG while the python script seems to be looking for RELEASE. I've moved on to a different problem now. Thanks!
any updates on this?

@piiswrong, thank you . I have add BLSTM.  I guess the problem is caused by batchnorm, but i don't kown how to solve it. I also will try the latest version mxnet
@DeanDon No I haven't
How about pooling using tanh and mse as evaluation metric?

@dneprDroid have you solved the problem? I try to implement lstm predictor in c_predict_api, but have some  problem. should I provide not only 'data' but also lstm's init state to MXPredCreate?
@piiswrong

I use the class BucketSentenceIter to define my data iter. 
Different from the original lstm demo , I apply the lstm model on   text classification, so I just have tow labels 0 and 1. while the original lstm demo has as many labels as the vocab. How can i modify the bucket_io.py to fit my data
@piiswrong Yes, I have tested it with cudnn4. It's a single line modification to fix the comping issue with cudnn4. It should not cause any error in travis-ci.
randomly sorted not sampled, only few samples are lost. others are all trained
Try adding label shape maybe help

```
File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/mxnet-0.7.0-py2.7.egg/mxnet/model.py", line 498, in _init_params
arg_params[k][:] = self.arg_params[k][:]
```
this means the shape of param you load is not equal to the shape inferred, try printing the `k` and param shapes in line 498 to get more info
@mli
use a tanh activation and RegressionOutput
This is usually because you used DataBatch(data=NDArray) instead of the correct DataBatch(data=[NDArray]) format

as above , I gave them "[]", it still throws a same error
this is my test model:

    data = mx.sym.Variable('data')
    embed_layer = mx.sym.Embedding(data=data, input_dim=vocab_size, output_dim=num_embed, name='vocab_embed')
    input1 = mx.sym.Reshape(data=embed_layer, target_shape=(batch_size, vocab_size*num_embed))
    fc1  = mx.sym.FullyConnected(data=input1, name='fc1', num_hidden =2)
    mlp  = mx.sym.SoftmaxOutput(data=fc1, name='softmax')

W=T.next()

is it the model that leads to the error
v0.7.0 and v0.8.0 is ok, master will bring this error.

it's unreasonable, where did you print before this line or after this line ?
```
arg_params[k][:] = self.arg_params[k][:]
```

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/24219258/21922005/e69b7f40-d9a6-11e6-88ff-48e022f2b131.png)

    mlp  = mx.sym.SoftmaxOutput(data=fc1, name='softmax')

what network are you using?
@tqchen
C++ version charRNN via MXNet.cpp API: https://github.com/dmlc/MXNet.cpp/tree/master/windows/vs/charRNN
@javelinjs
how to solve the googlenet problem? @miguelgfierro @mli @piiswrong thx
updates?

@fanlu  Hi , first of all your compile error has no direct bearing upon the PR.   

I guess you are using a incorrect git clone to get source code. checking this [page](http://mxnet.io/get_started/ubuntu_setup.html).
and take care:

    git clone https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet.git --recursive

do not lost --recursive argument in here.
@BobLiu20 I have used the compiler before --recursive, the latest cod include the nnvm module, but you fork out of the time there is no such this module. This should be inside the issue #4667
@howard0su

@benqua you can refer to https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/blob/master/example/image-classification/fine-tune.py to see how to do the finetuning in python, I think it should be easy to implement in Scala.
same error for me
I think that is because your data or parameters' NDArray are on different devices, e.g., data from dataiter is on cpu and other parameters are on gpu.
Or, you can 1) build the network structure (symbol) manually; 2) use `Symbol.bind` to get an `Executor`; 3) copy model params to `Executor.argDict`.

Nice, thank you.

And how do I "lock" the CNN layers so they don't get trained again?
please pull lastest master
LGTM
You can do it using `module` api. For Scala, it is still in progress: https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/pull/4583

I solved this problem by replacing cblas with satlas. Here is solution:
1. open Makefile in caffe source dir and locate "cblas"
2. Replace "cblas" with "satlas"

Note: My system is fedora 23

I have solved my problem by fixing the train and test data‘s width unchanged though they  are in different buckets. the reason why it throws a error after train is that the test data's width is  not equal to the train's

Thanks for the answer, exactly what i am looking for.

Hi @yuan1202 ,

I think I may have an answer for you. During the training phase, I just use the rmse metric, but for further analysis I do the following:

First, I make a prediction using the test set, and afterwards I analyse all the different metrics you can obtain from the confusion matrix (as you can see [here](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Receiver_operating_characteristic)). Also, you may be interested in the F1 Score metric.

I hope this is what you were looking for.

I encountered this issue as well. The way the code works today it will only find data that are in S3 folders, see https://github.com/dmlc/dmlc-core/blob/f1f366bafbae30dcacbe5a1407370b05f2aabef3/src/io/input_split_base.cc#L109-L111.
